name: incisiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact that an idea or opinion is expressed in a clear and direct way that shows good understanding of what is important: The presentation was delivered with wit and incisiveness. There is a deep social incisiveness all of her writing. See
incisive
More examplesFewer examplesThe historical analysis was a model of clarity and incisiveness.He sang the baritone solos with the verbal incisiveness of a great German lieder singer. Her colleagues will miss her intellectual incisiveness and her passion for justice.
